medical_history.chief_complaint: Mr. B presented with treatment-resistant chronic paranoid schizophrenia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. B's symptoms began approximately 8 years ago, worsening over several weeks before his first hospitalization for schizophrenia. He has had two previous psychiatric hospitalizations. Symptoms of auditory hallucinations worsened significantly leading up to recent admissions, with the latest acute episode marked by suicidal ideation and significant functional impairment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mr. B has a history of treatment-resistant chronic paranoid schizophrenia and two previous psychiatric hospitalizations. He has no history of violence, substance abuse, or suicide attempts.
medical_history.family_history: Mr. B's parents divorced when he was in grade school, and he continued to live with his mother and older sister. No specific family medical history is provided.
medical_history.social_history: Mr. B is a 27-year-old, single, unemployed man who lives with and is financially supported by his mother. He displays isolation and social withdrawal.
